pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, February 17, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, February 17, 2017:

Berlin, Germany

8:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Parliamentarians at the Deutsche Parlamentarische Gesellschaft.

Deutsche Parlamentarische Gesellschaft
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at beginning of the meeting


9:35 a.m. The Prime Minister will lay a wreath at the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe.

Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


12:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a welcoming ceremony with military honours at the Federal Chancellery.

Federal Chancellery
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


12:20 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a working luncheon given by the Chancellor of Germany, Angela Merkel.

Federal Chancellery
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Closed to media


1:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a joint media availability with the Chancellor of Germany.

Press Foyer, 1st Floor
Federal Chancellery
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


2:20 p.m. The Prime Minister, accompanied by the Chancellor of Germany and the Governing Mayor of Berlin, Michael Müller, will pay respects to the victims of the terrorist attack that took place at the Christmas Market in Breitscheidplatz.

Breitscheidplatz
Berlin, Germany

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


3:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart Berlin for Hamburg, Germany.

Berlin Tegel Airport
Berlin, Germany


Hamburg, Germany

4:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Hamburg, Germany.

Hamburg Airport
Hamburg, Germany

6:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the First Mayor of Hamburg, Olaf Scholz.

City Hall
Hamburg, Germany

Note for media:

  • Official photographers only


6:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the leaders of the German States.

City Hall
Hamburg, Germany

Note for media:

  • Official photographers only


7:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will sign the Golden Book.

Phönix Room
City Hall
Hamburg, Germany

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


8:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the St. Matthew’s Day Dinner and will deliver a speech.

Festsaal Room
City Hall
Hamburg, Germany

Note for media:

  • Open coverage


Note: all times local
